intro: Actinocephalus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved actinocephalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
